types.name: ARN
types.description:
An Amazon Web Services Amazon Resource Name (ARN), including the Region and account ID.
For more information, refer to [Amazon Resource Names](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-arns-and-namespaces.html).

types.name: AccessScope
types.description: Represents the permission required to access a Shopify Admin API or Storefront API resource for a shop. Access scopes are granted by merchants to requesting applications.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the resource access provided by the access scope when granted to an application.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: Represents the access scope as a readable string. Typically follows the format `{action}_{resource}`: a `read` or `write` action, followed by the resource on which the action is allowed to be performed on, separated by an underscore. For example, `read_orders`; `write_products`.

types.name: AdjustmentSale
types.description: A sale associated with an order price adjustment.

fields.name: actionType
fields.description: The type of order action that the sale represents.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the sale.

fields.name: lineType
fields.description: The line type assocated with the sale.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of units either ordered or intended to be returned.

fields.name: taxes
fields.description: All individual taxes associated with the sale.

fields.name: totalAmount
fields.description: The total sale amount after taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalDiscountAmountAfterTaxes
fields.description: The total discounts allocated to the sale after taxes.

fields.name: totalDiscountAmountBeforeTaxes
fields.description: The total discounts allocated to the sale before taxes.

fields.name: totalTaxAmount
fields.description: The total amount of taxes for the sale.

types.name: AllDiscountItems
types.description: Whether all items in the cart are entitled to the discount.

fields.name: allItems
fields.description: Whether all items are selected. The value is hardcoded to `true`.

types.name: ApiVersion
types.description:
A version of the API, as defined by [Shopify API versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).
Versions are commonly referred to by their handle (for example, `2021-10`).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The human-readable name of the version.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The unique identifier of an ApiVersion. All supported API versions have a date-based (YYYY-MM) or `unstable` handle.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: Whether the version is actively supported by Shopify. Supported API versions are guaranteed to be stable. Unsupported API versions include unstable, release candidate, and end-of-life versions that are marked as unsupported. For more information, refer to [Versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).

fields.description: The newly created app one-time purchase.

fields.name: confirmationUrl
fields.description:
The URL that the merchant can access to approve or decline the newly created app one-time purchase.

If the merchant declines, then the merchant is redirected to the app and receives a notification message stating that the charge was declined.
If the merchant approves and they're successfully invoiced, then the state of the charge changes from `pending` to `active`.

You get paid after the charge is activated.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: The list of errors that occurred from executing the mutation.

fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of AppPurchaseOneTimeEdge.

types.name: AppPurchaseStatus
types.description:
The approval status of the app purchase.

The merchant is charged for the purchase immediately after approval, and the status changes to `active`.
If the payment fails, then the app purchase remains `pending`.

Purchases start as `pending` and can change to: `active`, `declined`, `expired`. After a purchase changes, it
remains in that final state.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The app purchase has been approved by the merchant and is ready to be activated by the app. App purchases created through the GraphQL Admin API are activated upon approval.
enumValues.deprecationReason: As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant accepts an app purchase, the status immediately changes from `pending` to `active`.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The app purchase was approved by the merchant and has been activated by the app. Active app purchases are charged to the merchant and are paid out to the partner.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The app purchase was declined by the merchant.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The app purchase was not accepted within two days of being created.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The app purchase is pending approval by the merchant.

types.name: AppRecurringPricing
types.description:
The pricing information about a subscription app.
The object contains an interval (the frequency at which the shop is billed for an app subscription) and
a price (the amount to be charged to the subscribing shop at each interval).

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The frequency at which the subscribing shop is billed for an app subscription.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The amount and currency to be charged to the subscribing shop every billing interval.

types.name: AppRecurringPricingInput
types.description: Instructs the app subscription to generate a fixed charge on a recurring basis. The frequency is specified by the billing interval.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: How often the app subscription generates a charge.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: The amount to be charged to the store every billing interval. The only permitted currency code is USD.

types.name: AppSubscriptionStatus
types.description: The status of the app subscription.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The app subscription is pending approval by the merchant.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The app subscription has been approved by the merchant and is ready to be activated by the app.
enumValues.deprecationReason: As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant approves an app subscription, the status immediately transitions from `pending` to `active`.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The app subscription has been approved by the merchant. Active app subscriptions are billed to the shop. After payment, partners receive payouts.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was declined by the merchant. This is a terminal state.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The app subscription wasn't accepted within two days of being created. This is a terminal state.

enumValues.name: FROZEN
enumValues.description: The app subscription is on hold due to non-payment. The subscription re-activates after payments resume.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was cancelled by the app. This could be caused by the app being uninstalled, a new app subscription being activated, or a direct cancellation by the app. This is a terminal state.

types.name: AppUsagePricing
types.description:
Defines a usage pricing model for the app subscription.
These charges are variable based on how much the merchant uses the app.

fields.name: balanceUsed
fields.description: The total usage records for interval.

fields.name: cappedAmount
fields.description:
The capped amount prevents the merchant from being charged for any usage over that amount during a billing period.
This prevents billing from exceeding a maximum threshold over the duration of the billing period.
For the merchant to continue using the app after exceeding a capped amount, they would need to agree to a new usage charge.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The frequency with which the app usage records are billed.

fields.name: terms
fields.description:
The terms and conditions for app usage pricing.
Must be present in order to create usage charges.
The terms are presented to the merchant when they approve an app's usage charges.

types.name: AppUsagePricingInput
types.description: Allows an app to issue arbitrary charges for app usage associated with a subscription.

inputFields.name: cappedAmount
inputFields.description: The maximum amount of usage charges that can be incurred within a subscription billing interval.

inputFields.name: terms
inputFields.description: The terms and conditions for app usage. These terms stipulate the pricing model for the charges that an app creates.

fields.name: id

fields.name: price

fields.name: subscriptionLineItem

types.name: BulkOperation
types.description:
An asynchronous long-running operation to fetch data in bulk or to bulk import data.

Bulk operations are created using the `bulkOperationRunQuery` or `bulkOperationRunMutation` mutation. After
they are created, clients should poll the `status` field for updates. When `COMPLETED`, the `url` field contains
a link to the data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.

Refer to the [bulk operations guide](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/bulk-operations/imports) for more details.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was successfully completed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: Error code for failed operations.

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: File size in bytes of the file in the `url` field.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: objectCount
fields.description:
A running count of all the objects processed.
For example, when fetching all the products and their variants, this field counts both products and variants.
This field can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: partialDataUrl
fields.description:
The URL that points to the partial or incomplete response data (in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format) that was returned by a failed operation.
The URL expires 7 days after the operation fails. Returns `null` when there's no data available.

fields.name: query
fields.description: GraphQL query document specified in `bulkOperationRunQuery`.

fields.name: rootObjectCount
fields.description:
A running count of all the objects that are processed at the root of the query.
For example, when fetching all the products and their variants, this field only counts products.
This field can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the bulk operation.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The bulk operation's type.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The URL that points to the response data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.
The URL expires 7 days after the operation completes.

The provided operation `query` returned access denied due to missing
[access scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes).
Review the requested object permissions and execute the query as a normal non-bulk GraphQL request to see more details.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
enumValues.description:
The operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to internal server errors during execution.
These errors might be intermittent, so you can try performing the same query again.

enumValues.name: TIMEOUT
enumValues.description:
The operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to query timeouts during execution.
In some cases, timeouts can be avoided by modifying your `query` to select fewer fields.

types.name: Collection
types.description:
Represents a group of products that can be displayed in online stores and other sales channels in categories, which makes it easy for customers to find them. For example, an athletics store might create different collections for running attire, shoes, and accessories.

Collections can be defined by conditions, such as whether they match certain product tags. These are called smart or automated collections.

Collections can also be created for a custom group of products. These are called custom or manual collections.

fields.name: availablePublicationCount
fields.description: The number of publications a resource is published to without feedback errors.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A single-line, text-only description of the collection, stripped of any HTML tags and formatting that were included in the description.

args.name: truncateAt
args.description: Truncates string after the given length.

fields.name: descriptionHtml
fields.description: The description of the collection, including any HTML tags and formatting. This content is typically displayed to customers, such as on an online store, depending on the theme.

fields.name: feedback
fields.description: Information about the collection that's provided through resource feedback.

fields.name: handle
fields.description:
A unique string that identifies the collection. If a handle isn't specified when a collection is created, it's automatically generated from the collection's original title, and typically includes words from the title separated by hyphens. For example, a collection that was created with the title `Summer Catalog 2022` might have the handle `summer-catalog-2022`.

If the title is changed, the handle doesn't automatically change.

The handle can be used in themes by the Liquid templating language to refer to the collection, but using the ID is preferred because it never changes.

args.name: scale

types.name: Customer
types.description:
Represents information about a customer of the shop, such as the customer's contact details, their order
history, and whether they've agreed to receive marketing material by email.

Caution: Only use this data if the data is required for your app's functionality. Shopify retains the ability to restrict access to Shopify retains the ability to restrict access to [API Access scopes](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/oauth) for apps not requiring legitimate use of the associated data.

fields.name: acceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer has agreed to receive marketing material.

fields.name: acceptsMarketingUpdatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer consented or objected to receiving marketing material by email.

fields.description: A list of addresses associated with the customer.

args.name: first

fields.name: averageOrderAmount
fields.description: The average amount that the customer spent per order.

fields.name: averageOrderAmountV2
fields.description: The average amount that the customer spent per order.

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description:
Whether the merchant can delete the customer from their store.

A customer can be deleted from a store only if they have not yet made an order. After a customer makes an
order, they can't be deleted from a store.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer was added to the store.

fields.name: defaultAddress
fields.description: The default address associated with the customer.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
The full name of the customer, based on the values for first_name and last_name. If the first_name and
last_name are not available, then this falls back to the customer's email address, and if that is not available, the customer's phone number.

fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.description: A list of events associated with the customer.

inputFields.description: The date and time when the customer consented or objected to receiving marketing material by email.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description:
A list of tags to associate with the customer. Can be an array or a comma-separated list. Example values: `["tag1", "tag2", "tag3"]`, `"tag1, tag2, tag3"`

Updating `tags` overwrites any existing tags that were previously added to the customer. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd)
mutation.

The marketing consent information when the customer consented to receiving marketing
        material by SMS. The `phone` field is required when creating a customer with SMS
        marketing consent information.

inputFields.description: Whether the customer is exempt from paying taxes on their order.

inputFields.name: taxExemptions
inputFields.description: The list of tax exemptions to apply to the customer.

types.name: CustomerMarketingOptInLevel
types.description:
The possible values for the marketing subscription opt in level enabled at the time the customer consented to receive marketing information.

The levels are defined by [the M3AAWG best practices guideline
  document](https://www.m3aawg.org/sites/maawg/files/news/M3AAWG_Senders_BCP_Ver3-2015-02.pdf).

enumValues.name: SINGLE_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
After providing their information, the customer receives marketing information without any
intermediate steps.

enumValues.name: CONFIRMED_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
After providing their information, the customer receives a confirmation and is required to
perform a intermediate step before receiving marketing information.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The customer receives marketing information but how they were opted in is unknown.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description:
The customer's last subscription contract expired and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description:
The customer's last subscription contract failed and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: NEVER_SUBSCRIBED
enumValues.description: The customer has never had a subscription contract.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description:
The customer has at least one paused subscription contract and there are no other active
subscription contracts.

types.name: CustomerVisit
types.description: Represents a customer's session visiting a shop's online store, including information about the marketing activity attributed to starting the session.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: landingPage
fields.description: URL of the first page the customer landed on for the session.

fields.name: landingPageHtml
fields.description: Landing page information with URL linked in HTML. For example, the first page the customer visited was store.myshopify.com/products/1.

fields.name: marketingEvent
fields.description:
Represent actions taken by an app, on behalf of a merchant,
to market Shopify resources such as products, collections, and discounts.

fields.name: occurredAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer's session occurred.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_.
For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referralInfoHtml
fields.description: Referral information with URLs linked in HTML.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to the online store.
For example, _https://randomblog.com/page1_ or _android-app://com.google.android.gm_.

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source from which the customer visited the store, such as a platform (Facebook, Google), email, direct,
a website domain, QR code, or unknown.

fields.name: sourceDescription
fields.description: Describes the source explicitly for first or last session.

fields.name: sourceType
fields.description: Type of marketing tactic.

fields.name: utmParameters
fields.description: A set of UTM parameters gathered from the URL parameters of the referrer.

types.name: Date
types.description:
Represents an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)-encoded date string.
For example, September 7, 2019 is represented as `"2019-07-16"`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
Represents an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)-encoded date and time string.
For example, 3:30 pm on September 7, 2019 in the time zone of UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) is
represented as `"2019-09-07T15:50:00Z`".

types.name: DayOfTheWeek
types.description: Days of the week from Monday to Sunday.

types.name: Decimal
types.description:
A signed decimal number, which supports arbitrary precision and is serialized as a string.

Example values: `"29.99"`, `"29.999"`.

types.name: DeletionEvent
types.description:
Deletion events chronicle the destruction of resources (e.g. products and collections).
Once deleted, the deletion event is the only trace of the original's existence,
as the resource itself has been removed and can no longer be accessed.

types.name: DiscountApplicationAllocationMethod
types.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated onto its entitled lines.

enumValues.name: ACROSS
enumValues.description: The value is spread across all entitled lines.

enumValues.name: EACH
enumValues.description: The value is applied onto every entitled line.

enumValues.name: ONE
enumValues.description: The value is specifically applied onto a particular line.

types.name: DiscountApplicationLevel
types.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated onto its entitled lines.

enumValues.name: ORDER
enumValues.description:
The discount was applied at the order level.
Order level discounts are not factored into the discountedUnitPriceSet on line items.

enumValues.name: LINE
enumValues.description:
The discount was applied at the line level.
Line level discounts are factored into the discountedUnitPriceSet on line items.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetSelection
types.description:
Which lines on the order that the discount is allocated over, of the type
defined by the Discount Application's target_type.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto all the lines.

enumValues.name: ENTITLED
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto only the lines it is entitled for.

enumValues.name: EXPLICIT
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto explicitly chosen lines.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetType
types.description: The type of line (i.e. line item or shipping line) on an order that the discount is applicable towards.

enumValues.name: LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto line items.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_LINE
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto shipping lines.

enumValues.name: PRESENT
enumValues.description: The input value needs to be blank.

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be equal to the value allowed.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than the minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: TAKEN
enumValues.description: The input value is already taken.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOO_SHORT
enumValues.description: The input value is too short.

enumValues.name: VALUE_OUTSIDE_RANGE
enumValues.description: The value is outside the allowed range.

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_SUBTOTAL_AND_QUANTITY_RANGE_BOTH_PRESENT
enumValues.description: Cannot have both the minimum subtotal and quantity.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE_PERIOD_OVERLAP
enumValues.description: The active period overlaps with other automatic discounts. At any given time, only one automatic discount can be active.

enumValues.name: CONFLICT
enumValues.description: The attribute selection contains conflicting settings.

enumValues.name: IMPLICIT_DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The value is already present through another selection.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The input value is already present.

enumValues.name: INCLUSION
enumValues.description: The input value isn't included in the list.

Caution: Only use this data if the data is required for your app's functionality. Shopify retains the ability to restrict access to Shopify retains the ability to restrict access to [API Access scopes](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/oauth) for apps not requiring legitimate use of the associated data.

types.name: DraftOrderInput
types.description: The input fields used to create or update a draft order.

inputFields.name: appliedDiscount
inputFields.description:
The discount that will be applied to the draft order.
A draft order line item can have one discount. A draft order can also have one order-level discount.

inputFields.name: billingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address associated with the payment method.

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: Customer associated with the draft order.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: Extra information added to the customer.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The customer's email address.

inputFields.name: lineItems
inputFields.description:
Product variant line item or custom line item associated to the draft order.
Each draft order must include at least one line item.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Metafields attached to the draft order.

inputFields.name: privateMetafields
inputFields.description: The private metafields attached to the draft order.

inputFields.name: localizationExtensions
inputFields.description: The localization extensions attached to the draft order. For example, Tax IDs.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the draft order.

inputFields.name: shippingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped.

inputFields.name: shippingLine
inputFields.description: A shipping line object, which details the shipping method used.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: A comma separated list of tags that have been added to the draft order.

inputFields.name: taxExempt
inputFields.description:
Whether or not taxes are exempt for the draft order.
If false, then Shopify will refer to the taxable field for each line item.
If a customer is applied to the draft order, then Shopify will use the customer's tax exempt field instead.

inputFields.name: useCustomerDefaultAddress
inputFields.description: Sent as part of a draft order object to load customer shipping information.

inputFields.name: paymentTerms
inputFields.description: The fields used to create payment terms.

types.name: DraftOrderLineItem
types.description: Represents a line item included in a draft order.

fields.name: appliedDiscount
fields.description: Discount which will be applied to the line item or the overall order.

fields.name: custom
fields.description:
Whether this is a product variant line item, or a custom line item.
If set to true indicates a custom line item. If set to false indicates a product variant line item.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of additional information about the line item.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: Line item price after discounts are applied.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The `discountedTotal` divided by `quantity`, resulting in the value of the discount per unit.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
Name of the service provider who fulfilled the order.

Valid values are either **manual** or the name of the provider.
For example, **amazon**, **shipwire**.

Deleted fulfillment services will return null.

fields.name: grams
fields.description: Weight in grams. Can only be specified if this is a custom line item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the draft order line item.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: isGiftCard
fields.description: Whether the line item represents the puchase of a gift card.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the product.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The product corresponding to the line item’s product variant.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Number of variant items requested in the draft order.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: A list of tax line objects, each of which details the total taxes applicable to the order.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the product or variant (this field only applies to custom line items).

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: Total value of the discount applied to the line item.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: Associated variant for the line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Name of the variant.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: Name of the vendor who made the variant.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Weight unit and value for a draft order line item.

inputFields.description: Discount which will be applied to the line item.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: Represents a generic custom attribute using a key value pair.

inputFields.name: originalUnitPrice
inputFields.description: The price without any discounts applied. This value is ignored when `variantId` is provided.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The number of products that were purchased.

inputFields.name: requiresShipping
inputFields.description: Whether physical shipping is required. This value is ignored when `variantId` is provided.

inputFields.name: sku

inputFields.description:
The ID of the product variant corresponding to the line item.
Null if custom line item. Required if product variant line item.

inputFields.description:
Specifies the weight unit and value inputs.
This value is ignored when `variantId` is provided.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: File error has occurred for an unknown reason.

enumValues.name: INVALID_SIGNED_URL
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the signed URL was invalid.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the image could not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_PROCESSING_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the image could not be processed.

enumValues.name: MEDIA_TIMEOUT_ERROR
enumValues.description: File timed out because it is currently being modified by another operation.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the external video could not be found.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_UNLISTED
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the external video is not listed or is private.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_INVALID_ASPECT_RATIO

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_EMBED_DISABLED
enumValues.description: File could not be created because embed permissions are disabled for this video.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_EMBED_NOT_FOUND_OR_TRANSCODING

enumValues.name: GENERIC_FILE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the source could not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_FILE_INVALID_SIZE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the size is too large.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_METADATA_READ_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the metadata could not be read.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_INVALID_FILETYPE_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it has an invalid file type.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_WIDTH_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the minimum width requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_WIDTH_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the maximum width requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_HEIGHT_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the minimum height requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_HEIGHT_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the maximum height requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_DURATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the minimum duration requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_DURATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the maximum duration requirement.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_THUMBNAIL_GENERATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the model's thumbnail generation failed.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_GLB_TO_USDZ_CONVERSION_ERROR

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_GLB_OUTPUT_CREATION_ERROR

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_PROCESSING_FAILURE

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_IMAGE_FILE_TYPE

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_FILE_SIZE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the image size is too large.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_ASPECT_RATIO

enumValues.name: FILE_STORAGE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED

types.name: Fulfillment
types.description: Represents a fulfillment. In Shopify, a fulfillment represents a shipment of one or more items in an order. When an order has been completely fulfilled, it means that all the items that are included in the order have been sent to the customer. There can be more than one fulfillment for an order.

fields.name: events

types.description:

in an order that are to be fulfilled from the same location. There can be more than one fulfillment order
for an order at a given location.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderAction
types.description: The actions that can be taken on a fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: CREATE_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Creates a fulfillment for selected line items in the fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentCreateV2`.

enumValues.name: REQUEST_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Sends a request for fulfilling selected line items in a fulfillment order to a fulfillment service. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderSubmitFulfillmentRequest`.

enumValues.name: CANCEL_FULFILLMENT_ORDER
enumValues.description: Cancels a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderCancel`.

enumValues.name: MOVE
enumValues.description: Moves a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderMove`.

enumValues.name: REQUEST_CANCELLATION
enumValues.description: Sends a cancellation request to the fulfillment service of a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderSubmitCancellationRequest`.

enumValues.name: MARK_AS_OPEN
enumValues.description: Marks the fulfillment order as open. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderOpen`.

enumValues.name: RELEASE_HOLD
enumValues.description: Releases the fulfillment hold on the fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderReleaseHold`.

enumValues.name: HOLD
enumValues.description: Applies a fulfillment hold on an open fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderHold`.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL
enumValues.description: Opens an external URL to initiate the fulfillment process outside Shopify. This action should be paired with `FulfillmentOrderSupportedAction.externalUrl`.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation
types.description:
Represents the assigned location of a fulfillment order, which is a snapshot of the location
at which the fulfillment order was created. The assigned location is expected to perform fulfillment.

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The first line of the address for the location.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: The second line of the address for the location.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city of the location.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: The two-letter country code of the location.

fields.name: location
fields.description:
The location where the fulfillment order was created. This can differ from the
`FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation` if the location was updated since the fulfillment order
was closed.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the location.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number of the location.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The province of the location.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The ZIP code of the location.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderAssignmentStatus
types.description: The assigment status to be used to filter fulfillment orders.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_REQUESTED
enumValues.description:
Fulfillment orders for which the merchant has requested cancellation of
the previously accepted fulfillment request.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: Fulfillment orders for which the merchant has requested fulfillment.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_ACCEPTED
enumValues.description:
Fulfillment orders for which the merchant's fulfillment request has been accepted.
Any number of fulfillments can be created on these fulfillment orders
to completely fulfill the requested items.

types.name: ID

The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.

Example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`

fields.description:
The location of the transformed image as a URL.

All transformation arguments are considered "best-effort". If they can be applied to an image, they will be.
Otherwise any transformations which an image type does not support will be ignored.

args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3.

args.name: preferredContentType
args.description: Best effort conversion of image into content type (SVG -> PNG, Anything -> JPG, Anything -> WEBP are supported).

args.name: transform
args.description: A set of options to transform the original image.

Supported conversions: `.svg` to `.png`, any file type to `.jpg`, and any file type to `.webp`.

types.name: JSON
Job
types.description: A job corresponds to some long running task that the client should poll for status.

fields.name: done
fields.description: This indicates if the job is still queued or has been run.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier that's returned when running an asynchronous mutation.

fields.name: query
fields.description: This field will only resolve once the job is done. Can be used to ask for object(s) that have been changed by the job.

types.name: LegacyInteroperability
types.description:
Interoperability metadata for types that directly correspond to a REST Admin API resource.
For example, on the Product type, LegacyInteroperability returns metadata for the corresponding [Product object](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/product) in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

types.name: LimitedPendingOrderCount
types.description:
The total number of pending orders on a shop if less then a maximum, or that maximum.
The atMax field indicates when this maximum has been reached.

fields.name: atMax
fields.description: This is set when the number of pending orders has reached the maximum.

fields.name: count
fields.description:
The number of pendings orders on the shop.
Limited to a maximum of 10000.

types.name: LineItem
types.description: Represents a single line item on an order.

fields.name: canRestock
fields.description: Whether the line item can be restocked.

fields.name: contract
fields.description: The subscription contract associated with this line item.

fields.name: currentQuantity
fields.description: The line item's quantity, minus the removed quantity.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of additional information about the line item.

fields.name: discountAllocations
fields.description: The discounts that have been allocated onto the line item by discount applications.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied, in shop currency.

fields.name: discountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The approximate split price of a line item unit, in shop currency. This value doesn't include discounts applied to the entire order.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The approximate split price of a line item unit, in shop and presentment currencies. This value doesn't include discounts applied to the entire order.

fields.name: duties
fields.description: The duties associated with the line item.

fields.name: fulfillableQuantity
fields.description: The total number of units to fulfill.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
The service provider that fulfills the line item.

Deleted fulfillment services will return null.

fields.name: fulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
The line item's fulfillment status. Returns 'fulfilled' if fulfillableQuantity >= quantity,
'partial' if  fulfillableQuantity > 0, and 'unfulfilled' otherwise.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image associated to the line item's variant.

args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.description: Whether the line item can be edited or not.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the product.

fields.description: The total number of units that can't be fulfilled. For example, if items have been refunded, or the item is not something that can be fulfilled, like a tip.

fields.description: The total price without discounts applied, in shop currency. ""This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.description: The total price in shop and presentment currencies, without discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: The variant unit price without discounts applied, in shop currency.

fields.name: originalUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The variant unit price without discounts applied, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: The taxes charged for this line item.

types.name: MarketingActivityStatus
types.description: Status helps to identify if this marketing activity has been completed, queued, failed etc.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently running.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is permanently unavailable.

enumValues.name: DELETED_EXTERNALLY
enumValues.description: This marketing activity was deleted and it was triggered from outside of Shopify.

enumValues.name: DISCONNECTED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is disconnected and no longer editable.

enumValues.name: DRAFT
enumValues.description: This marketing activity has been edited, but it is not yet created.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is unable to run.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity has completed running.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently not running.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is pending creation on the app's marketing platform.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is scheduled to run.

enumValues.name: UNDEFINED
enumValues.description: The marketing activity's status is unknown.

types.name: MarketingActivityStatusBadgeType
types.description: StatusBadgeType helps to identify the color of the status badge.

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: This status badge has type default.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: This status badge has type success.

enumValues.name: ATTENTION
enumValues.description: This status badge has type attention.

enumValues.name: WARNING
enumValues.description: This status badge has type warning.

enumValues.name: INFO
enumValues.description: This status badge has type info.

Where the `MarketingEvent` occurred and what kind of content was used.
Because `utmSource` and `utmMedium` are often used interchangeably, this is
based on a combination of `marketingChannel`, `referringDomain`, and `type` to
provide a consistent representation for any given piece of marketing
regardless of the app that created it.

merchant to edit metafield values in context.

the metafield. For example, for a metafield with the type `date`, you can set a minimum date validation, so
that the metafield will only store dates after the specific minimum date.

types.name: MetafieldDefinitionValidation
types.description:
A configured metafield definition validation.

For example, for a metafield definition of `number_integer` type, you can set a validation with the name `max`
and a value of `15`. This validation will ensure that the value of the metafield is a number less than or equal to 15.

Refer to the [list of supported validations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin/graphql/reference/common-objects/metafieldDefinitionTypes#examples-Fetch_all_metafield_definition_types).

fields.name: value
fields.description: The validation value.

types.name: MetafieldDefinitionValidationInput
types.description:
The name and value for a metafield definition validation.

For example, for a metafield definition of `single_line_text_field` type, you can set a validation with the name `min` and a value of `10`.
This validation will ensure that the value of the metafield is at least 10 characters.

Refer to the [list of supported validations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin/graphql/reference/common-objects/metafieldDefinitionTypes#examples-Fetch_all_metafield_definition_types).

inputFields.name: name

enumValues.description: Asynchronous validation of this definition's metafields is in progress.

enumValues.name: SOME_INVALID
enumValues.description: Some of this definition's metafields are invalid.

fields.name: appCreditCreate
fields.description: Allows an app to create a credit for a shop that can be used towards future app purchases.

args.name: description
args.description: The description of the app credit.

args.name: amount
args.description: The amount that can be used towards future app purchases in Shopify.The only permitted currency code is USD.

args.name: test
args.description: Specifies whether the app credit is a test transaction.

fields.name: appPurchaseOneTimeCreate
fields.description:
Charges a shop for features or services one time.
This type of charge is recommended for apps that aren't billed on a recurring basis.
Test and demo shops aren't charged.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the one-time purchase from the app.

args.name: price
args.description: The amount to be charged to the store for the app one-time purchase. The only permitted currency code is USD.

args.name: returnUrl
args.description: The URL where the merchant is redirected after approving the app one-time purchase.

args.name: test
args.description: Whether the app one-time purchase is a test transaction. The default value is `false`.

fields.name: appRevenueAttributionRecordCreate
fields.description: Creates a record of the attributed revenue for the app. This mutation should only be used to capture transactions that are not managed by the Billing API.

args.name: appRevenueAttributionRecord
args.description: The app revenue attribution record to be created.

fields.name: appRevenueAttributionRecordDelete
fields.description: Deletes a record of the attributed revenue for the app.

args.name: id
args.description: The unique identifier of the revenue attribution record.

fields.name: appSubscriptionCancel
fields.description: Cancels an app subscription on a store.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the app subscription to be cancelled.

fields.name: appSubscriptionCreate
fields.description: Allows an app to charge a store for features or services on a recurring basis.

args.name: name
args.description: A descriptive name for the app subscription.

args.name: lineItems
args.description: Attaches one or more pricing plans to an app subscription. Only one pricing plan can be defined for each available type.

args.name: test
args.description: Whether the app subscription is a test transaction. The default value is `false`.

args.name: trialDays
args.description: The number of days of the free trial period, beginning on the day that the merchant approves the app charges.

args.name: returnUrl
args.description: The URL pointing to the page where the merchant is redirected after approving the app subscription.

fields.name: appSubscriptionLineItemUpdate
fields.description: Updates the capped amount on the usage pricing plan of an app subscription line item.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the app subscription line item to be updated.

args.name: cappedAmount
args.description: The new maximum amount of usage charges that can be incurred within a subscription billing interval.

fields.name: appUsageRecordCreate
fields.description: Creates an app usage record.

args.name: subscriptionLineItemId
args.description: The ID of the app subscription line item to create the usage record under. This app subscription line item must have a usage pricing plan.

args.name: price
args.description: The price of the app usage record. The only permitted currceny code is USD.

args.name: description
args.description: The description of the app usage record.

fields.name: bulkOperationCancel

There may be a short delay from when a cancelation starts until the operation is actually canceled.

For example, you could add a gift wrapping service as a [custom line item](https://shopify.dev/api/examples/order-editing#add-a-custom-line-item). To learn how to edit existing orders, refer to [Edit an existing order with Admin API](https://shopify.dev/api/examples/order-editing).

args.name: id
args.description:
The ID of the [calculated order](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/calculatedorder)

args.description: The name of the custom item to add.

args.description:
The ID of the retail [location](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/location)
(if applicable) from which the custom item is sold. Used for tax calculations. A default location will be chosen automatically if none is provided.

args.description: The unit price of the custom item. This value can't be negative.

args.description: The quantity of the custom item. This value must be greater than zero.

args.description: Whether the custom item is taxable. Defaults to `true`.

args.name: requiresShipping
args.description: Whether the custom item requires shipping. Defaults to `false`.

You can use the `priceListUpdate` mutation to update an existing price list for a country. This lets you change product pricing on a per country basis. As part of the mutation, you can change the name, percentage-based adjustment, currency, and country.

types.name: Navigable
types.description:
A default cursor that you can use in queries to paginate your results. Each edge in a connection can
return a cursor, which is a reference to the edge's position in the connection. You can use an edge's cursor as
the starting point to retrieve the nodes before or after it in a connection.

To learn more about using cursor-based pagination, refer to
[Paginating results with GraphQL](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/pagination-graphql).

fields.name: defaultCursor
fields.description: A default cursor that returns the single next record, sorted ascending by ID.

and [nodes](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/unstable/queries/nodes) queries.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

An article in the blogging system. You can query articles from
[the REST API](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-rest/latest/resources/article
if you need to access more information about an article. Currently, `OnlineStoreArticle` is
only useful to pass an article `id` to the `tagsAdd` mutation. For more information, refer to
the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd) mutation.

types.name: Order
types.description:
An order is a customer's request to purchase one or more products from a shop. You can retrieve and update orders using the Order object.
Learn more about [editing an existing order with the Admin API](https://shopify.dev/api/examples/order-editing).

Only the last 60 days' worth of orders from a store are accessible from the `Order` object by default. If you want to access older orders,
then you need to [request access to all orders](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/oauth#orders-permissions). If your app is granted
access, then you can add the `read_all_orders` scope to your app along with `read_orders` or `write_orders`.
[Private apps](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/basic-http) are not affected by this change and are automatically granted the scope.

Caution: Only use this data if the data is required for your app's functionality. Shopify retains the ability to restrict access to Shopify retains the ability to restrict access to [API Access scopes](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/oauth) for apps not requiring legitimate use of the associated data.

fields.name: agreements
fields.description: A list of sales agreements associated with the order.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns up to the last `n` elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

args.description: Reverse the order of the underlying list.

args.name: query
args.description:
Supported filter parameters:
 - `happened_at`

See the detailed [search syntax](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/search-syntax)
for more information about using filters.

fields.name: alerts

fields.name: app

fields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
fields.description: Whether the billing address matches the shipping address.

fields.name: canMarkAsPaid
fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

fields.name: canNotifyCustomer

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
The reason provided when the order was canceled.
Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: capturable
fields.description: Whether payment for the order can be captured.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmount
fields.description: The total order-level discount amount, before returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The total order-level discount amount, before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel that created the order.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the API client that created the order.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was closed.
Returns `null` if the order is not closed.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The shop currency when the order was placed.

fields.name: currentCartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The current order-level discount amount after all order updates, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: currentSubtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for all line items that contribute to the order's current subtotal price.

fields.name: currentSubtotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: currentTaxLines
fields.description:
A list of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, after returns.
Tax line prices represent the total price for all tax lines with the same `rate` and `title`.

fields.name: currentTotalDiscountsSet
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: currentTotalDutiesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of duties after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if duties aren't applicable.

fields.name: currentTotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The total price of the order, after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: currentTotalTaxSet
fields.description: The sum of the prices of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: currentTotalWeight
fields.description: The total weight of the order after returns, in grams.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of the custom attributes added to the order.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer that placed the order.

fields.name: customerAcceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer agreed to receive marketing materials.

fields.name: customerJourney
fields.description: The customer's visits and interactions with the online store before placing the order.

fields.name: customerJourneySummary
fields.description: The customer's visits and interactions with the online store before placing the order.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description: A two-letter or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: A list of discounts that are applied to the order.

The financial status of the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the details of an order's financial state. It should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.name: displayFulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
The fulfillment status for the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the details of an order's fulfillment state. It should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.description: A list of draft fulfillments that can be created for the order, which includes line items that can be partially fulfilled.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: Whether the order has had any edits applied.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address associated with the customer.

fields.name: estimatedTaxes
fields.description:
Whether taxes on the order are estimated.
This field returns `false` when taxes on the order are finalized and aren't subject to any changes.

fields.name: events
fields.description: A list of events associated with the order.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The unique identifier for the order that appears on the order page in the Shopify admin and the order status page.
For example, "#1001", "EN1001", or "1001-A".
This value isn't unique across multiple stores.

fields.name: netPayment
fields.description: The net payment for the order, based on the total amount received minus the total amount refunded, in shop currency.

fields.name: netPaymentSet
fields.description: The net payment for the order, based on the total amount received minus the total amount refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: nonFulfillableLineItems
fields.description:
A list of line items that can't be fulfilled.
For example, tips and fully refunded line items can't be fulfilled.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The contents of the note associated with the order.

fields.name: originalTotalDutiesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of duties before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if duties aren't applicable.

fields.name: originalTotalPriceSet
fields.description: The total price of the order at the time of order creation, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: paymentCollectionDetails
fields.description: The payment collection details for the order.

fields.name: paymentGatewayNames
fields.description:
A list of the names of all payment gateways used for the order.
For example, "Shopify Payments" and "Cash on Delivery (COD)".

fields.name: paymentTerms
fields.description: The payment terms associated with the order.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number associated with the customer.

fields.name: physicalLocation
fields.description:
The fulfillment location that was assigned when the order was created.
Use the [`FulfillmentOrder`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/fulfillmentorder) object for up to date fulfillment location information.

fields.name: presentmentCurrencyCode
fields.description: The payment `CurrencyCode` of the customer for the order.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was processed.
This date and time might not match the date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: The publication that the order was created from.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
The marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: "ref", "source", or "r".
For example, if the URL is `{shop}.myshopify.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2`, then this value is `j2tj1tn2`.

fields.name: referrerDisplayText
fields.description: A web domain or short description of the source that sent the customer to your online store. For example, "shopify.com" or "email".

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description: The URL of the webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to your online store.

fields.name: refundDiscrepancySet
fields.description: The difference between the suggested and actual refund amount of all refunds that have been applied to the order. A positive value indicates a difference in the merchant's favor, and a negative value indicates a difference in the customer's favor.

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Whether the order can be refunded.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: A list of refunds that have been applied to the order.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether the order has shipping lines or at least one line item on the order that requires shipping.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether any line item on the order can be restocked.

fields.name: riskLevel
fields.description: The fraud risk level of the order.

fields.name: risks
fields.description: A list of risks associated with the order.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: The mailing address of the customer.

fields.name: shippingLine
fields.description: A summary of all shipping costs on the order.

fields.name: shippingLines
fields.description: A list of the order's shipping lines.

fields.name: subtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for all line items that contribute to the order's subtotal price.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and before returns, in shop currency.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: subtotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: suggestedRefund
fields.description: A suggested refund for the order.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.description:
The amount to refund for shipping. Overrides the `refundShipping` argument.
Use the `shippingAmountV2` argument for multi-currency orders.

args.name: refundShipping
args.description: Whether to refund the full shipping amount.

args.name: refundLineItems
args.description: The line items from the order to include in the refund.

args.name: refundDuties
args.description: The duties from the order to include in the refund.

args.name: suggestFullRefund
args.description:
Whether the suggested refund should be created from all refundable line items on the order.
If `true`, the `refundLineItems` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
A comma separated list of tags associated with the order. Updating `tags` overwrites
any existing tags that were previously added to the order. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd)
mutation.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description:
A list of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, before returns.
Tax line prices represent the total price for all tax lines with the same `rate` and `title`.

fields.name: taxesIncluded
fields.description: Whether taxes are included in the subtotal price of the order.

fields.name: test
fields.description:
Whether the order is a test.
Test orders are made using the Shopify Bogus Gateway or a payment provider with test mode enabled.
A test order cannot be converted into a real order and vice versa.

fields.name: totalCapturable
fields.description:
The authorized amount that is uncaptured or undercaptured, in shop currency.
This amount isn't adjusted for returns.

fields.name: totalCapturableSet
fields.description:
The authorized amount that is uncaptured or undercaptured, in shop and presentment currencies.
This amount isn't adjusted for returns.

fields.name: totalDiscounts
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order before returns, in shop currency.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: totalDiscountsSet
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: totalOutstandingSet
fields.description:
The total amount not yet transacted for the order, in shop and presentment currencies.
A positive value indicates a difference in the merchant's favor (payment from customer to merchant) and a negative value indicates a difference in the customer's favor (refund from merchant to customer).

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description:
The total price of the order, before returns, in shop currency.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalPriceSet
fields.description:
The total price of the order, before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalReceived
fields.description: The total amount received from the customer before returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalReceivedSet
fields.description: The total amount received from the customer before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefunded
fields.description: The total amount that was refunded, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalRefundedSet
fields.description: The total amount that was refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefundedShippingSet
fields.description: The total amount of shipping that was refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalShippingPrice
fields.description: The total shipping amount before discounts and returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalShippingPriceSet
fields.description: The total shipping amount before discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: The total tax amount before returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalTaxSet
fields.description: The total tax amount before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTipReceived
fields.description: The sum of all tip amounts for the order, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalTipReceivedSet
fields.description: The sum of all tip amounts for the order, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalWeight
fields.description: The total weight of the order before returns, in grams.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: A list of transactions associated with the order.

args.name: capturable
args.description: Filter transactions by whether they are capturable.

args.name: manuallyResolvable
args.description:
Filter transactions by whether they can be resolved manually.
For example, fully captured or voided transactions are not manually resolvable.

fields.name: unpaid
fields.description: Whether no payments have been made for the order.

fields.description: The date and time when the order was modified last.

inputFields.description: The currency (in ISO format) that is used to capture the order. This must be the presentment currency (the currency used by the customer) and is a required field for orders where the currency and presentment currency differ.

types.name: OrderDisplayFinancialStatus
types.description: Represents the order's current financial status.

types.name: OrderDisplayFulfillmentStatus
types.description: Represents the order's aggregated fulfillment status for display purposes.

enumValues.name: UNFULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Unfulfilled**. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: PARTIALLY_FULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Partially fulfilled**. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: FULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Fulfilled**. All the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: RESTOCKED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Restocked**. All the items in the order have been restocked. Replaced by the "UNFULFILLED" status.

enumValues.name: PENDING_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Pending fulfillment**. A request for fulfillment of some items awaits a response from the fulfillment service. Replaced by the "IN_PROGRESS" status.

enumValues.name: OPEN
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Open**. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled. Replaced by "UNFULFILLED" status.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Displayed as **In progress**. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled, or a request for fulfillment has been sent to the fulfillment service.

enumValues.name: ON_HOLD
enumValues.description: Displayed as **On hold**. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are on hold.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Scheduled**. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are scheduled for fulfillment at later time.

The likelihood that an order is fraudulent, based on this order risk.

The level can be set by Shopify risk analysis or by an app.

enumValues.name: LOW

enumValues.name: MEDIUM

enumValues.name: HIGH
enumValues.description: There is a high level of risk that this order is fraudulent.

results by relevance to the search term(s). When no search query is specified, this sort key is not
deterministic and should not be used.

types.name: OrderTransaction
types.description: A payment transaction in the context of an order.

fields.name: accountNumber
fields.description: The masked account number associated with the payment method.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of money.

fields.name: amountSet
fields.description: The amount and currency of the transaction in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: amountV2
fields.description: The amount and currency of the transaction.

fields.name: authorizationCode
fields.description: Authorization code associated with the transaction.

fields.name: authorizationExpiresAt
fields.description: The time when the authorization expires. This field is available only to stores on a Shopify Plus plan and is populated only for Shopify Payments authorizations.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the transaction was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: A standardized error code, independent of the payment provider.

fields.name: fees
fields.description: The transaction fees charged on the order transaction. Only present for Shopify Payments transactions.

fields.name: formattedGateway
fields.description: The human-readable payment gateway name used to process the transaction.

fields.name: gateway
fields.description: The payment gateway used to process the transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of transaction.

fields.name: manuallyCapturable
fields.description: Whether the transaction can be manually captured.

fields.name: maximumRefundable
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount to refund on the gateway.
This value is only available for transactions of type `SuggestedRefund`.

fields.name: maximumRefundableV2
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to refund on the gateway.
This value is only available for transactions of type `SuggestedRefund`.

fields.name: order
fields.description: The associated order.

fields.name: parentTransaction
fields.description: The associated parent transaction, for example the authorization of a capture.

fields.name: paymentIcon
fields.description: The payment icon to display for the transaction.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: paymentMethod
fields.description: The payment method used for the transaction. This value is `null` if the payment method is unknown.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description: Date and time when the transaction was processed.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description:
The transaction receipt that the payment gateway attaches to the transaction.
The value of this field depends on which payment gateway processed the transaction.

fields.name: settlementCurrency
fields.description: The settlement currency.

fields.name: settlementCurrencyRate
fields.description: The rate used when converting the transaction amount to settlement currency.

fields.name: shopifyPaymentsSet
fields.description: Contains all Shopify Payments information related to an order transaction. This field is available only to stores on a Shopify Plus plan.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this transaction.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the transaction is a test transaction.

fields.name: totalUnsettled
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount to capture on the gateway.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

fields.name: totalUnsettledSet
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to capture on the gateway in shop and presentment currencies.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

fields.name: totalUnsettledV2
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to capture on the gateway.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.
