types.name: OrderTransactionErrorCode
types.description: A standardized error code, independent of the payment provider.

enumValues.name: INVALID_NUMBER
enumValues.description: The format of the card number is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE
enumValues.description: The format of the expiry date is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CVC
enumValues.description: The format of the CVC is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_CVC
enumValues.description: The CVC does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ZIP
enumValues.description: The ZIP or postal code does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The address does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the payment.

enumValues.name: PICK_UP_CARD
enumValues.description: The card has been reported as lost or stolen, and the card issuer has requested that the merchant keep the card and call the number on the back.

enumValues.name: CONFIG_ERROR
enumValues.description: There is an error in the gateway or merchant configuration.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE_LIVE_CARD
enumValues.description: A real card was used but the gateway was in test mode.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE
enumValues.description: The gateway or merchant configuration doesn't support a feature, such as network tokenization.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unknown error with processing the payment.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COUNTRY
enumValues.description: The payment method is not available in the customer's country.

enumValues.name: INVALID_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The amount is either too high or too low for the provider.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The payment method is momentarily unavailable.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_CHARGED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been captured.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_REFUNDED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been refunded.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AUTHORIZATIONS_CAPTURED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 authorizations has been captured for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_REFUNDS_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 refunds has been processed for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_ORDER_REFERENCE_CANCELED
enumValues.description: The order was canceled, which canceled all open authorizations.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_STALE
enumValues.description: The order was not confirmed within three hours.

inputFields.description: The payment gateway to use for this transaction.

inputFields.description: The ID of the optional parent transaction, for example the authorization of a capture.

types.name: OrderTransactionKind
types.description: The different kinds of order transactions.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: An authorization and capture performed together in a single step.

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: A transfer of the money that was reserved by an authorization.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description:
An amount reserved against the cardholder's funding source.
Money does not change hands until the authorization is captured.

enumValues.name: VOID
enumValues.description: A cancelation of an authorization transaction.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description:
A partial or full return of captured funds to the cardholder.
A refund can happen only after a capture is processed.

enumValues.name: CHANGE
enumValues.description: The money returned to the customer when they've paid too much during a cash transaction.

enumValues.name: EMV_AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

enumValues.name: SUGGESTED_REFUND
enumValues.description: A suggested refund transaction that can be used to create a refund.

types.description: The different states that an `OrderTransaction` can have.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the transaction.

types.name: PriceList
types.description:
Represents a price list, including information about related prices and eligibility rules.
You can use price lists to specify either fixed prices or adjusted relative prices that
override initial product variant prices. Price lists are applied to customers
using context rules, which determine price list eligibility.

  For more information on price lists, refer to
  [*Support different pricing models using the price list API*](https://shopify.dev/api/examples/product-price-lists#update-an-existing-price-list).

fields.name: contextRule
fields.description: A set of facts about the customer, used to determine price list eligibility.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency for fixed prices associated with this price list.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unique name of the price list, used as a human-readable identifier.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Relative adjustments to other prices.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: A list of prices associated with the price list.

args.name: originType
args.description:
The origin of this price, either fixed (defined on the price list)
               or relative (calculated using an adjustment via a price list parent configuration).

args.name: first
args.description: Returns up to the first `n` elements from the list.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns up to the last `n` elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: reverse
args.description: Reverse the order of the underlying list.

The value of price adjustment, where positive numbers
          reduce the prices and negative numbers increase them.

types.name: PriceListParent
types.description:
Represents relative adjustments from one price list to other prices.
  You can use a `PriceListParent` to specify an adjusted relative price using a percentage-based
  adjustment. Adjusted prices work in conjunction with exchange rules and rounding.

  [Adjustment types](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/pricelistadjustmenttype)
  support both percentage increases and decreases.

fields.name: adjustment
fields.description: A price list adjustment.

types.name: PriceListParentCreateInput
types.description: Provides the fields and values to use when creating a price list parent adjustment.

inputFields.name: adjustment
inputFields.description: Provides the fields and values to use when updating a price list parent adjustment.

types.name: PriceListParentUpdateInput
types.description: Relative adjustments to other prices.

inputFields.name: adjustment
inputFields.description: Provides the fields and values to use when updating a price list parent adjustment.

types.name: PriceListPrice
types.description:
Represents information about pricing for a product variant
        as defined on a price list, such as the price, compare at price, and origin type. You can use a PriceListPrice to specify a fixed price for a specific product variant.

fields.name: compareAtPrice
fields.description: The compare-at price of the product variant on this price list.

fields.name: originType
fields.description:
The origin of this price, either fixed (defined on the price list)
          or relative (calculated using an adjustment via a price list parent configuration).

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price of the product variant on this price list.

fields.name: variant

types.name: PriceRule
types.description: Price rules are a set of conditions, including entitlements and prerequisites, that must be met in order for a discount code to apply. We recommend using the [Discount types](https://shopify.dev/api/examples/discounts) available in the GraphQL Admin API, which are intended to replace the GraphQL `PriceRule` object and REST Admin `PriceRule` and `DiscountCode` resources.

types.description: Possible error codes that could be returned by a price rule mutation.

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be equal to the value allowed.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than the minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: TAKEN
enumValues.description: The input value is already taken.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOO_SHORT
enumValues.description: The input value is too short.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_ALLOCATION_LIMIT_ON_NON_BOGO
enumValues.description: The allocation limit can only be set on buy-one-get-one type discounts.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_ALLOCATION_LIMIT_IS_ZERO
enumValues.description: The allocation limit must be a non-zero positive number.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_EXCEEDED_MAX_DISCOUNT_CODE
enumValues.description: The number of discount codes in the shop has reached its limit.

enumValues.name: SHOP_EXCEEDED_MAX_PRICE_RULES
enumValues.description: The number of discounts in the shop has reached its limit.

enumValues.name: END_DATE_BEFORE_START_DATE
enumValues.description: The discount end date must be after the start date.

enumValues.name: PRICE_RULE_PERCENTAGE_VALUE_OUTSIDE_RANGE
enumValues.description: The percentage value must be between 0 and -100.

enumValues.name: PREREQUISITE_SUBTOTAL_AND_QUANTITY_RANGE_BOTH_PRESENT
enumValues.description: Only one of the minimum subtotal or minimum quantity condition can be defined.

enumValues.name: ALLOCATION_METHOD_MUST_BE_ACROSS_FOR_GIVEN_TARGET_SELECTION
enumValues.description: The allocation method must be "across" for the provided target selection.

enumValues.name: APPLIES_ON_NOTHING
enumValues.description: The discount must apply on either one-time purchase or subscription items, or both.

enumValues.name: MULTIPLE_RECURRING_CYCLE_LIMIT_FOR_NON_SUBSCRIPTION_ITEMS
enumValues.description: The recurring cycle limit must be 1 when a discount does not apply on subscription items.

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX
enumValues.description: Exceeding the maximum number is allowed.

types.name: Product
types.description: The Product resource lets you manage products in a merchant’s store. You can use [ProductVariants](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/productvariant) to create or update different versions of the same product. You can also add or update product [Media](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/interfaces/media). Products can be organized by grouping them into a [Collection](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/collection).

types.name: RefundLineItemRestockType
types.description: The type of restock performed for a particular refund line item.

enumValues.name: RETURN
enumValues.description: The refund line item was returned. Use this when restocking line items that were fulfilled.

enumValues.name: CANCEL
enumValues.description: The refund line item was canceled. Use this when restocking unfulfilled line items.

enumValues.name: LEGACY_RESTOCK
enumValues.description: Deprecated. The refund line item was restocked, without specifically beingidentified as a return or cancelation. This value is not accepted when creating new refunds.

enumValues.name: NO_RESTOCK
enumValues.description: Refund line item was not restocked.

types.description:
Presents information or problems to merchants, with 1 or more actions that they can take.
They can optionally have a specific icon and be dismissed by merchants.

Buttons in the alert that link to related information.
For example, _View risk assessment_.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Details about the alert.

fields.name: dismissibleHandle
fields.description:
Unique identifier that appears when an alert is manually closed by the merchant.
Most alerts cannot be manually closed.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: Icon that displays with the alert.

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Indication of how important the alert is.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name of the alert.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Action title.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Action target URL.

types.name: ResourceAlertIcon

types.name: ResourceAlertSeverity
types.description: The possible severity levels for a resource alert.

Whether the Shopify CDN can cache and serve the script tag.
If `true`, then the script will be cached and served by the CDN.
The cache expires 15 minutes after the script tag is successfully returned.

types.name: SellingPlan
types.description:
Represents how a product can be sold and purchased. Selling plans and associated records (selling plan groups
and policies) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing
up these records if you need to restore them later.

For more information on selling plans, refer to
[*Creating and managing selling plans*](https://shopify.dev/apps/subscriptions/selling-plans).

fields.name: billingPolicy
fields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the recurring billing details.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan was created.

fields.name: deliveryPolicy
fields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the delivery details.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan commitment.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
A customer-facing description of the selling plan.

If your store supports multiple currencies, then don't include country-specific pricing content, such as "Buy monthly, get 10$ CAD off". This field won't be converted to reflect different currencies.

fields.name: options
fields.description: The values of all options available on the selling plan. Selling plans are grouped together in Liquid when they are created by the same app, and have the same `selling_plan_group.name` and `selling_plan_group.options` values.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Relative position of the selling plan for display. A lower position will be displayed before a higher position.

fields.name: pricingPolicies
fields.description: Selling plan pricing details.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchor
types.description: Represents a selling plan policy anchor.

fields.name: day
fields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is not WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

fields.name: month
fields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, this field must be null, otherwise it must be
between 1-12.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Represents the anchor type, it can be one one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchorInput
types.description: Specifies the input fields required to create or update a selling plan anchor.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Represents the anchor type, must be one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

inputFields.name: day
inputFields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is not WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

inputFields.name: month
inputFields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, this field must be null, otherwise it must be
between 1-12.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchorType
types.description: Represents the anchor type.

enumValues.name: WEEKDAY
enumValues.description: Which day of the week, between 1-7.

enumValues.name: MONTHDAY
enumValues.description: Which day of the month, between 1-31.

enumValues.name: YEARDAY
enumValues.description: Which days of the month and year, month between 1-12, and day between 1-31.

types.name: SellingPlanBillingPolicy
types.description:
Represents the billing frequency associated to the selling plan (for example, bill every week, or bill every
three months). The selling plan billing policy and associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans, pricing
policies, and delivery policy) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app.
We recommend backing up these records if you need to restore them later.

types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `SellingPlanGroupUserError`.

enumValues.name: PRESENT
enumValues.description: The input value needs to be blank.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than the minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: NOT_A_NUMBER
enumValues.description: The input value is not a number.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOO_SHORT
enumValues.description: The input value is too short.

enumValues.name: TAKEN
enumValues.description: The input value is already taken.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_COUNT_LOWER_BOUND
enumValues.description: Must include at least one selling plan.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MAX_CYCLES_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_MIN_CYCLES
enumValues.description: Selling plan's billing policy max cycles must be greater than min cycles.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_BILLING_AND_DELIVERY_POLICY_ANCHORS_MUST_BE_EQUAL
enumValues.description: Selling plan's billing and delivery policies anchors must be equal.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_BILLING_CYCLE_MUST_BE_A_MULTIPLE_OF_DELIVERY_CYCLE
enumValues.description: Selling plan's billing cycle must be a multiple of delivery cycle.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_PRICING_POLICIES_MUST_CONTAIN_A_FIXED_PRICING_POLICY
enumValues.description: Selling plan's pricing policies must contain one fixed pricing policy.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MISSING_OPTION2_LABEL_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Cannot define option2 on this selling plan as there's no label on the parent selling plan group.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MISSING_OPTION3_LABEL_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Cannot define option3 on this selling plan as there's no label on the parent selling plan group.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_OPTION2_REQUIRED_AS_DEFINED_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Selling plan's option2 is required because option2 exists.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_OPTION3_REQUIRED_AS_DEFINED_ON_PARENT_GROUP
enumValues.description: Selling plan's option3 is required because option3 exists.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_PRICING_POLICIES_LIMIT
enumValues.description: Selling plans can't have more than 2 pricing policies.

enumValues.name: RESOURCE_LIST_CONTAINS_INVALID_IDS
enumValues.description: The selling plan list provided contains 1 or more invalid IDs.

enumValues.name: GROUP_DOES_NOT_EXIST
enumValues.description: Selling plan group does not exist.

enumValues.name: GROUP_COULD_NOT_BE_DELETED
enumValues.description: Selling plan group could not be deleted.

enumValues.name: ERROR_ADDING_RESOURCE_TO_GROUP
enumValues.description: Could not add the resource to the selling plan group.

enumValues.name: PLAN_ID_MUST_BE_SPECIFIED_TO_UPDATE
enumValues.description: Selling plan ID must be specified to update.

enumValues.name: ONLY_NEED_ONE_PRICING_POLICY_TYPE
enumValues.description: Only one pricing policy type can be defined.

enumValues.name: ONLY_NEED_ONE_PRICING_POLICY_VALUE
enumValues.description: Only one pricing policy adjustment value type can be defined.

enumValues.name: PRICING_POLICY_ADJUSTMENT_VALUE_AND_TYPE_MUST_MATCH
enumValues.description: Pricing policy's adjustment value and adjustment type must match.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_DUPLICATE_NAME
enumValues.description: Cannot have multiple selling plans with the same name.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_DUPLICATE_OPTIONS
enumValues.description: Cannot have multiple selling plans with the same options.

types.name: SellingPlanInput

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the selling plan.

inputFields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan content.

inputFields.description: Selling plan policy which describes the billing details.

inputFields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the delivery details.

inputFields.description:
The pricing policies which describe the pricing details. Each selling plan
can only contain a maximum of 2 pricing policies.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: The values of all options available on the selling plan. Selling plans are grouped together in Liquid when they are created by the same app, and have the same `selling_plan_group.name` and `selling_plan_group.options` values.

inputFields.name: position
inputFields.description: Relative value for display purposes of this plan. A lower position will be displayed before a higher one.

types.name: SellingPlanInterval
types.description: Represents valid selling plan interval.

types.name: SellingPlanPricingPolicy
types.description:
Represents the type of pricing associated to the selling plan (for example, a $10 or 20% discount that is set
for a limited period or that is fixed for the duration of the subscription). Selling plan pricing policies and
associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans, billing policy, and delivery policy) are deleted 48
hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing up these records if you need
to restore them later.

inputFields.description: The number of intervals between billings.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicy
types.description: Represents a recurring selling plan delivery policy.

fields.name: anchors
fields.description: Specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan delivery policy was created.

fields.name: cutoff
fields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

fields.name: intent
fields.description:
Specifies if the delivery policy is merchant or buyer-centric.
Buyer-centric delivery policies state the time when the buyer will receive the goods.
Merchant-centric delivery policies state the time when the fulfillment should be started.
Currently, only merchant-centric delivery policies are supported.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The delivery frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

fields.name: intervalCount
fields.description: The number of intervals between deliveries.

fields.name: preAnchorBehavior
fields.description: Fulfillment or delivery behavior of the first fulfillment when the order is placed before the anchor. The default value for this field is `ASAP`.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyInput
types.description: Specifies the input fields to create or update a recurring delivery policy.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: The delivery frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

inputFields.name: intervalCount
inputFields.description: The number of intervals between deliveries.

inputFields.name: anchors
inputFields.description: Specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

inputFields.name: cutoff
inputFields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

inputFields.name: intent
inputFields.description: Intention of this delivery policy, it can be either: delivery or fulfillment.

inputFields.name: preAnchorBehavior
inputFields.description: The pre anchor behavior. It can be either: asap or next.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyIntent
types.description: Possible intentions of a Delivery Policy.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_BEGIN
enumValues.description: A merchant-centric delivery policy. Mark this delivery policy to define when the merchant should start fulfillment.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyPreAnchorBehavior
types.description: Possible fulfillment or delivery behaviors of the first fulfillment when the orderis placed before the anchor.

enumValues.name: ASAP
enumValues.description: Orders placed can be fulfilled / delivered immediately. Orders placed inside a cutoff can be fulfilled / delivered at the next anchor.

enumValues.name: NEXT
enumValues.description:
Orders placed can be fulfilled / delivered at the next anchor date.
Orders placed inside a cutoff will skip the next anchor and can be fulfilled /
delivered at the following anchor.

Possible branding of a shop.
Branding can be used to define the look of a shop including its styling and logo in the Shopify Admin.

Represents the feature set available to the shop.
Most fields specify whether a feature is enabled for a shop, and some fields return information
related to specific features.

fields.description: The branding of the shop, which influences its look and feel in the Shopify admin.

fields.description: Whether a shop's online store can have CAPTCHA protection.

fields.name: captchaExternalDomains
fields.description: Whether a shop's online store can have CAPTCHA protection for domains not managed by Shopify.

fields.description: Whether the delivery profiles functionality is enabled for this shop.
fields.deprecationReason: Delivery profiles are now 100% enabled across Shopify.

fields.name: dynamicRemarketing
fields.description: Whether a shop has access to the Google Analytics dynamic remarketing feature.

fields.name: eligibleForSubscriptionMigration
fields.description: Whether a shop can be migrated to use Shopify subscriptions.

fields.name: eligibleForSubscriptions
fields.description: Whether a shop is configured properly to sell subscriptions.

fields.name: giftCards
fields.description: Whether a shop can create gift cards.

fields.name: harmonizedSystemCode
fields.description:
Whether a shop displays Harmonized System codes on products. This is used for customs when shipping
internationally.

fields.description: Whether a shop can enable international domains.

fields.name: internationalPriceOverrides
fields.description: Whether a shop can enable international price overrides.

fields.name: internationalPriceRules
fields.description: Whether a shop can enable international price rules.

fields.name: legacySubscriptionGatewayEnabled
fields.description: Whether a shop has enabled a legacy subscription gateway to handle older subscriptions.

fields.name: liveView
fields.description:
Whether to show the Live View metrics in the Shopify admin. Live view is hidden from merchants that are on a trial
or don't have a storefront.

fields.name: multiLocation
fields.description: Whether a shop has multi-location functionality.

fields.name: onboardingVisual
fields.description: Whether a shop has access to the onboarding visual.

fields.name: paypalExpressSubscriptionGatewayStatus
fields.description: Whether a shop is configured to sell subscriptions with PayPal Express.

fields.name: reports
fields.description: Whether a shop has access to all reporting features.

fields.name: sellsSubscriptions
fields.description: Whether a shop has ever had subscription products.

fields.name: shopifyPlus
fields.description: Whether the shop has a Shopify Plus subscription.

fields.name: showMetrics
fields.description: Whether to show metrics in the Shopify admin. Metrics are hidden for new merchants until they become meaningful.

fields.name: storefront

fields.description: Whether a shop is using Shopify Balance.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDisputeReason
types.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's bank.

enumValues.name: FRAUDULENT
enumValues.description: The cardholder claims that they didn’t authorize the payment.

enumValues.name: GENERAL
enumValues.description: The dispute is uncategorized, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

enumValues.name: UNRECOGNIZED
enumValues.description: The customer doesn’t recognize the payment appearing on their card statement.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The customer claims they were charged multiple times for the same product or service.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that you continued to charge them after a subscription was canceled.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_UNACCEPTABLE
enumValues.description: The product or service was received but was defective, damaged, or not as described.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_NOT_RECEIVED
enumValues.description: The customer claims they did not receive the products or services purchased.

enumValues.name: CREDIT_NOT_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that the purchased product was returned or the transaction was otherwise canceled, but you haven't yet provided a refund or credit.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ACCOUNT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The customer account associated with the purchase is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank account has insufficient funds.

enumValues.name: BANK_CANNOT_PROCESS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank can't process the charge.

enumValues.name: DEBIT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The customer's bank can't proceed with the debit since it hasn't been authorized.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_INITIATED
enumValues.description: The customer initiated the dispute. Contact the customer for additional details on why the payment was disputed.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutInterval
types.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Each week, on the day of week specified by weeklyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Each month, on the day of month specified by monthlyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Payouts will not be automatically made.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutSchedule
types.description: The payment schedule for a payments account.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

fields.name: monthlyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

fields.name: weeklyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutStatus
types.description: The transfer status of the payout.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description:
The payout has been created and had transactions assigned to it, but
it has not yet been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT
enumValues.description: The payout has been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The payout has been successfully deposited into the bank.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The payout has been declined by the bank.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The payout has been canceled by Shopify.

types.name: StandardMetafieldDefinitionTemplate
types.description:
Standard metafield definition templates provide preset configurations to create metafield definitions.
Each template has a specific namespace and key that we've reserved to have specific meanings for common use cases.

Refer to the [list of standard metafield definitions](https://shopify.dev/apps/metafields/definitions/standard-definitions).

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the standard metafield definition.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key owned by the definition after the definition has been activated.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The human-readable name for the standard metafield definition.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: The namespace owned by the definition after the definition has been activated.

fields.name: ownerTypes
fields.description: The list of resource types that the standard metafield definition can be applied to.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The associated [metafield definition type](https://shopify.dev/apps/metafields/definitions/types) that the metafield stores.

fields.name: validations
fields.description: The configured validations for the standard metafield definition.

types.name: SubscriptionBillingAttemptErrorCode
types.description:
The possible error codes associated with making billing attempts. The error codes supplement the
`error_message` to provide consistent results and help with dunning management.

enumValues.name: INVALID_PAYMENT_METHOD
enumValues.description: Payment method is invalid. Please update or create a new payment method.

enumValues.name: UNEXPECTED_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unexpected error during the billing attempt.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_DECLINED
enumValues.description: Payment method was declined by processor.

enumValues.name: AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error during the authentication.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE
enumValues.description: Gateway is in test mode and attempted to bill a live payment method.

enumValues.name: BUYER_CANCELED_PAYMENT_METHOD
enumValues.description: Payment method was canceled by buyer.

enumValues.name: INVALID_SHIPPING_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The shipping address is either missing or invalid.

types.name: SubscriptionBillingAttemptInput

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethodInput

Specifies delivery method fields for a subscription draft.
This is an input union: one, and only one, field can be provided.
The field provided will determine which delivery method is to be used.

Note: Only `shipping` is supported for now, but other inputs will be
added as they become supported in subscriptions.

types.name: SubscriptionDraftErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `SubscriptionDraftUserError`.

enumValues.name: ALREADY_REMOVED
enumValues.description: This line has already been removed.

enumValues.name: COMMITTED
enumValues.description: Subscription draft has been already committed.

enumValues.name: NOT_AN_INTEGER
enumValues.description: The value is not an integer.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MAX_CYCLES_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_MIN_CYCLES
enumValues.description: The maximum number of cycles must be greater than the minimum.

enumValues.name: DELIVERY_MUST_BE_MULTIPLE_OF_BILLING
enumValues.description: The delivery policy interval must be a multiple of the billing policy interval.

enumValues.name: INVALID_LINES
enumValues.description: Must have at least one line.

enumValues.name: NO_ENTITLED_LINES
enumValues.description: Discount must have at least one entitled line.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_MISMATCH
enumValues.description: The payment method customer must be the same as the contract customer.

enumValues.name: DELIVERY_METHOD_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: The delivery method can't be blank if any lines require shipping.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_DISCOUNTS_UNIQUE_AFTER_CYCLE
enumValues.description: The after cycle attribute must be unique between cycle discounts.

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADJUSTMENT_TYPE
enumValues.description: The adjustment value must the same type as the adjustment type.

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADJUSTMENT_VALUE
enumValues.description: The adjustment value must be either fixed_value or percentage.

enumValues.name: STALE_CONTRACT
enumValues.description: Another operation updated the contract concurrently as the commit was in progress.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than the minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOO_SHORT
enumValues.description: The input value is too short.

types.name: SubscriptionLine
types.description: Represents a Subscription Line.

fields.name: currentPrice
fields.description: The price per unit for the subscription line in the contract's currency.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of custom attributes associated to the line item.

fields.name: discountAllocations
fields.description: Discount allocations.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier.

fields.name: lineDiscountedPrice
fields.description: Total line price including all discounts.

fields.name: pricingPolicy
fields.description: Describe the price changes of the line over time.

fields.name: productId
fields.description: The product id associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the unit selected for the subscription line.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: sellingPlanId
fields.description:
The selling plan ID associated to the line.

Indicates which selling plan was used to create this
contract line initially. The selling plan ID is also used to
find the associated delivery profile.

The subscription contract, subscription line, or selling plan might have
changed. As a result, the selling plan's attributes might not
match the information on the contract.

fields.name: sellingPlanName
fields.description:
The selling plan name associated to the line. This name describes
the order line items created from this subscription line
for both merchants and customers.

The value can be different from the selling plan's name, because both
the selling plan's name and the subscription line's selling_plan_name
attribute can be updated independently.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number of the item associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product title of the item associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: variantId
fields.description: The product variant id associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: variantImage
fields.description: The image associated with the line item's variant or product.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Product variant title of the item associated with the subscription line.

types.name: SuggestedRefund
types.description: Represents a refund suggested by Shopify based on the items being reimbursed. You can then use the suggested refund object to generate an actual refund.

fields.name: maximumRefundableSet
fields.description: The total monetary value available to refund in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: refundDuties

fields.name: refundLineItems
fields.description: A list of line items to be refunded, along with restock instructions.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: The shipping costs to be refunded from the order.

fields.name: subtotal
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of the line items being refunded.

fields.name: subtotalSet
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of the line items being refunded in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: suggestedTransactions
fields.description: A list of suggested order transactions.

fields.name: totalCartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The total cart discount amount that was applied to all line items in this refund.

fields.name: totalDutiesSet
fields.description: The sum of all the duties being refunded from the order in shop and presentment currencies. The value must be positive.

fields.name: totalTaxSet
fields.description: The sum of the taxes being refunded from the order in shop and presentment currencies. The value must be positive.

fields.name: totalTaxes
fields.description: The sum of the taxes being refunded from the order. The value must be positive.

types.name: TenderTransaction
types.description:
A TenderTransaction represents a transaction with financial impact on a shop's balance sheet. A tender transaction always
represents actual money movement between a buyer and a shop. TenderTransactions can be used instead of OrderTransactions
for reconciling a shop's cash flow. A TenderTransaction is immutable once created.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount and currency of the tender transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: paymentMethod
fields.description: Information about the payment method used for the transaction.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description: Date and time when the transaction was processed.

fields.name: remoteReference
fields.description: The remote gateway reference associated with the tender transaction.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the transaction is a test transaction.

fields.name: transactionDetails
fields.description: Information about the payment instrument used for the transaction.

types.name: URL
types.description:
Represents an [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) and
[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.

For example, `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"` is a valid URL. It includes a scheme (`https`) and a host
(`johns-apparel.myshopify.com`).

types.name: UTMInput
types.description:
Specifies the
[Urchin Traffic Module (UTM) parameters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTM_parameters)
that are associated with a related marketing campaign.

inputFields.name: campaign
inputFields.description: The name of the UTM campaign.

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description: The name of the website or application where the referral link exists.

inputFields.name: medium
inputFields.description: The UTM campaign medium.

types.name: UTMParameters
types.description: Represents a set of UTM parameters.

fields.name: campaign
fields.description: The name of a marketing campaign.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Identifies specific content in a marketing campaign. Used to differentiate between similar content or links in a marketing campaign to determine which is the most effective.

fields.name: medium
fields.description: The medium of a marketing campaign, such as a banner or email newsletter.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source of traffic to the merchant's store, such as Google or an email newsletter.

fields.name: term
fields.description: Paid search terms used by a marketing campaign.

An unsigned 64-bit integer. Represents whole numeric values between 0 and 2^64 - 1 encoded as a string of base-10 digits.

Example value: `"50"`.

For more information, see [`url-redirect`](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/online-store/menus-and-links/url-redirect)s.

types.name: WebhookSubscription
types.description:
A webhook subscription is a persisted data object created by an app using the REST Admin API or GraphQL Admin API.
It describes the topic that the app wants to receive, and a destination where Shopify should send webhooks of the specified topic.
When an event for a given topic occurs, the webhook subscription sends a relevant payload to the destination.
Learn more about the [webhooks system](https://shopify.dev/apps/webhooks).

fields.name: callbackUrl
fields.description: The destination URI to which the webhook subscription will send a message when an event occurs.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the webhook subscription was created.

fields.name: endpoint
fields.description: The endpoint to which the webhook subscription will send events.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format in which the webhook subscription should send the data.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: includeFields
fields.description: An optional array of top-level resource fields that should be serialized and sent in the webhook message. If null, then all fields will be sent.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: metafieldNamespaces
fields.description: The list of namespaces for any metafields that should be included in the webhook subscription.

fields.name: privateMetafieldNamespaces
fields.description: The list of namespaces for private metafields that should be included in the webhook subscription.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook. The topic determines when the webhook subscription sends a webhook, as well as what class of data object that webhook contains.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the webhook subscription was updated.

types.name: WebhookSubscriptionTopic
types.description:
The supported topics for webhook subscriptions. You can use webhook subscriptions to receive
notifications about particular events in a shop.

You don't create webhook subscriptions to
[mandatory webhooks](https://shopify.dev/apps/webhooks/configuration/mandatory-webhooks).
Instead, you configure mandatory webhooks in your Partner Dashboard as part of your app setup.

enumValues.name: APP_UNINSTALLED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `app/uninstalled` events. Occurs whenever a shop has uninstalled the app.

enumValues.name: CARTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `carts/create` events. Occurs when a cart is created in the online store. Other types of carts aren't supported. For example, the webhook doesn't support carts that are created in a custom storefront. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CARTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `carts/update` events. Occurs when a cart is updated in the online store. Other types of carts aren't supported. For example, the webhook doesn't support carts that are updated in a custom storefront. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CHANNELS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `channels/delete` events. Occurs whenever a channel is deleted. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `checkouts/create` events. Occurs whenever a checkout is created. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUTS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `checkouts/delete` events. Occurs whenever a checkout is deleted. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `checkouts/update` events. Occurs whenever a checkout is updated. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_PAYMENT_METHODS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_payment_methods/create` events. Occurs whenever a customer payment method is created. Requires the `read_customer_payment_methods` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_PAYMENT_METHODS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_payment_methods/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer payment method is updated. Requires the `read_customer_payment_methods` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_PAYMENT_METHODS_REVOKE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_payment_methods/revoke` events. Occurs whenever a customer payment method is revoked. Requires the `read_customer_payment_methods` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_LISTINGS_ADD
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_listings/add` events. Occurs whenever a collection listing is added. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_LISTINGS_REMOVE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_listings/remove` events. Occurs whenever a collection listing is removed. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_LISTINGS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_listings/update` events. Occurs whenever a collection listing is updated. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_PUBLICATIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_publications/create` events. Occurs whenever a collection publication listing is created. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_PUBLICATIONS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_publications/delete` events. Occurs whenever a collection publication listing is deleted. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_PUBLICATIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_publications/update` events. Occurs whenever a collection publication listing is updated. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collections/create` events. Occurs whenever a collection is created. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTIONS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collections/delete` events. Occurs whenever a collection is deleted. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collections/update` events. Occurs whenever a collection is updated, including whenever products are added or removed from the collection. Occurs once if multiple products are added or removed from a collection at the same time. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_GROUPS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_groups/create` events. Occurs whenever a customer saved search is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_GROUPS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_groups/delete` events. Occurs whenever a customer saved search is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_GROUPS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_groups/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer saved search is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/create` events. Occurs whenever a customer is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/delete` events. Occurs whenever a customer is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_DISABLE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/disable` events. Occurs whenever a customer account is disabled. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_ENABLE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/enable` events. Occurs whenever a customer account is enabled. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_MARKETING_CONSENT_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers_marketing_consent/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer's marketing consent is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: DISPUTES_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `disputes/create` events. Occurs whenever a dispute is created. Requires the `read_shopify_payments_disputes` scope.

enumValues.name: DISPUTES_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `disputes/update` events. Occurs whenever a dispute is updated. Requires the `read_shopify_payments_disputes` scope.

enumValues.name: DRAFT_ORDERS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `draft_orders/create` events. Occurs whenever a draft order is created. Requires the `read_draft_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: DRAFT_ORDERS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `draft_orders/delete` events. Occurs whenever a draft order is deleted. Requires the `read_draft_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: DRAFT_ORDERS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `draft_orders/update` events. Occurs whenever a draft order is updated. Requires the `read_draft_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_EVENTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `fulfillment_events/create` events. Occurs whenever a fulfillment event is created. Requires the `read_fulfillments` scope.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_EVENTS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `fulfillment_events/delete` events. Occurs whenever a fulfillment event is deleted. Requires the `read_fulfillments` scope.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `fulfillments/create` events. Occurs whenever a fulfillment is created. Requires the `read_fulfillments` scope.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `fulfillments/update` events. Occurs whenever a fulfillment is updated. Requires the `read_fulfillments` scope.

enumValues.name: ATTRIBUTED_SESSIONS_FIRST
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `attributed_sessions/first` events. Occurs whenever an order with a "first" attributed session is attributed. Requires the `read_marketing_events` scope.

enumValues.name: ATTRIBUTED_SESSIONS_LAST
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `attributed_sessions/last` events. Occurs whenever an order with a "last" attributed session is attributed. Requires the `read_marketing_events` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDER_TRANSACTIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `order_transactions/create` events. Occurs when a order transaction is created or when it's status is updated. Only occurs for transactions with a status of success, failure or error. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/cancelled` events. Occurs whenever an order is cancelled. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/create` events. Occurs whenever an order is created. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/delete` events. Occurs whenever an order is deleted. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_EDITED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/edited` events. Occurs whenever an order is edited. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_FULFILLED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/fulfilled` events. Occurs whenever an order is fulfilled. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_PAID
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/paid` events. Occurs whenever an order is paid. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_PARTIALLY_FULFILLED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/partially_fulfilled` events. Occurs whenever an order is partially fulfilled. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: ORDERS_UPDATED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `orders/updated` events. Occurs whenever an order is updated. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_LISTINGS_ADD
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `product_listings/add` events. Occurs whenever an active product is listed on a channel. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_LISTINGS_REMOVE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `product_listings/remove` events. Occurs whenever a product listing is removed from the channel. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_LISTINGS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `product_listings/update` events. Occurs whenever a product publication is updated. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED_PRODUCT_LISTINGS_ADD
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `scheduled_product_listings/add` events. Occurs whenever a product is scheduled to be published. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED_PRODUCT_LISTINGS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `scheduled_product_listings/update` events. Occurs whenever a product's scheduled availability date changes. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED_PRODUCT_LISTINGS_REMOVE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `scheduled_product_listings/remove` events. Occurs whenever a product is no longer scheduled to be published. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_PUBLICATIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `product_publications/create` events. Occurs whenever a product publication for an active product is created, or whenever an existing product publication is published. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_PUBLICATIONS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `product_publications/delete` events. Occurs whenever a product publication for an active product is removed, or whenever an existing product publication is unpublished. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_PUBLICATIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `product_publications/update` events. Occurs whenever a product publication is updated. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `products/create` events. Occurs whenever a product is created. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCTS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `products/delete` events. Occurs whenever a product publication is deleted. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: PRODUCTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `products/update` events. Occurs whenever a product is updated, or whenever a product is ordered, or whenever a variant is added, removed, or updated. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: REFUNDS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `refunds/create` events. Occurs whenever a new Refund is created on an order. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_ADDRESSES_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `shipping_addresses/create` events. Occurs whenever a shipping address is created. Requires the `read_shipping` scope.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_ADDRESSES_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `shipping_addresses/update` events. Occurs whenever a shipping address is updated. Requires the `read_shipping` scope.

enumValues.name: SHOP_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `shop/update` events. Occurs whenever a shop is updated.

enumValues.name: TAX_SERVICES_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `tax_services/create` events. Occurs whenever a tax service is created. Requires the `read_taxes` scope.

enumValues.name: TAX_SERVICES_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `tax_services/update` events. Occurs whenver a tax service is updated. Requires the `read_taxes` scope.

enumValues.name: THEMES_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `themes/create` events. Occurs whenever a theme is created. Does not occur when theme files are created. Requires the `read_themes` scope.

enumValues.name: THEMES_DELETE

enumValues.name: THEMES_UPDATE

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: accessRestricted
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as having restricted access.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains the reason around this restriction
